intro: Eriogonum novonudum, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum novonudum is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
